item.title: 10 Games Where You Turn Death Into Strategy
item.description:
No one likes to die in a video game. It can be incredibly frustrating, especially if players are stuck on a boss they can’t beat. Desperate players will look up strategy guides or videos. They may even try cheating if the game has codes or hidden exploits, like finding ways to gain extra money or EXP in an RPG.

However, there are some games in which players can manipulate death to get ahead. It’s a rare circumstance, but anyone who likes a good game where strategy is involved should check these games out. They’re not easy, but some of the most rewarding games rarely are.

Hollow Knight: Silksong

The Cocoon Strategy

Hollow Knight: Silksong
53
9.1 /10
Released
September 4, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone 10+ / Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood
Powered by

Hollow Knight: Silksong is one of the hardest games of 2025, but there is a surefire way to get past bosses with a simple trick. To heal or use special attacks, Hornet will use Silk. Upon death, she will leave a Cocoon behind, along with gathered Rosaries, which are the game’s currency. If players destroy the cocoon, they will get back their Rosaries and fill up their Silk meter.

Players can use this in a boss room as a means of insurance, to have an extra way to restore Silk during the battle if they need healing badly. If they die in the fight, and then come back to try again, they can destroy the cocoon when things get desperate.

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

The Trick Is In The Name

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice
20
9.5 /10
Released
March 22, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice is the one modern FromSoftware game that doesn’t have any RPG leveling-up systems. Instead, players can get gear and items to become stronger, plus the game’s overall gimmick can help.

When players die, they can resurrect themselves on the spot. By playing possum for a bit, gamers can use this to their advantage to execute a sneak attack on the enemy who just killed them, or even run away to readjust strategy.

Hades

Entering God Mode

Hades
10 /10
17
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Hades is a tough but fair roguelike, and there is an advantage in the options menu to make it a more accessible game. Players can choose to use God Mode, which will defend players from damage by 20%. Every time players die, this percentage will increase, meaning they will technically become stronger. Players could abuse the system and just keep dying over and over without progressing much, but that wouldn’t be much fun.

Castle Crashers

Keep Up The Rhythm

Castle Crashers
8 /10
8.8 /10
Released
August 27, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood and Gore, Cartoon Violence, Crude Humor
Powered by

Castle Crashers is one of the best modern brawlers of the 2000s, and is still worth playing today even though it is over a decade old. Alone or in groups of four, players can fight hordes of enemies with a wide cast of characters.

In co-op, if an ally falls, players can revive them with a little mini-game. Hitting the heart at the right angle will heal characters more. If a player is on their last legs, they can purposely die and rely on their allies to revive them to gain a health boost.

Borderlands 4

One Last Chance

Borderlands 4
8 /10
30
8.2 /10
Released
September 12, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Powered by

The Borderlands series has had a cool mechanic since the first game, which is still present in Borderlands 4 . When players lose their health, they will enter a state called “Fight For Your Life.” If players manage to kill an enemy within this window, they will be revived for partial HP. If players are about to die anyway, they could strategically get shot and then blast away until they can revive themselves to get a quick heal.

Super Time Force

Time Bandits

Super Time Force
8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 82 /100 Critics Rec: 73%

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Super Time Force is a somewhat modern 2D action platformer akin to Contra, but with a time-based twist. When a character dies, they will leave an echo behind of past actions. Players can rewind time to place a new character to fight alongside this echo, which will still damage enemies. It involves more strategy than a pure run-and-gun game, as players need to use death to their advantage to set traps for enemies.

Final Fantasy 9

Born To Die

Final Fantasy 9
26
9.3 /10
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

The Final Fantasy series has various spells that can sacrifice a character’s life in exchange for healing or destructive powers. One of the best examples is in Final Fantasy 9 via the main character, Zidane. Late in the game, Zidane can learn the Sacrifice ability. By killing himself, he will heal the HP and MP of the other three party members, which is useful in specific circumstances.

Hotel Barcelona

The Phantom Strikes

Hotel Barcelona
5 /10
Released
September 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Hotel Barcelona is a new game by Suda51 and Swery65, two of the most talented Japanese video game auteurs. It’s a 2D roguelike wherein players are trapped within a hotel’s landscape and can only escape upon defeating evil souls.

Upon death, players will create a Phantom of their last playthrough. Leveling up certain skills will make these auto-playing Phantoms stronger, and thus give players reasons to plan their death around the next run to tackle the level’s boss with a full Phantom force.

Disgaea: Hour Of Darkness

Reincarnate And Become Stronger

Disgaea: Hour of Darkness
Tactical
Strategy
RPG
Systems
Released
August 27, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The Disgaea series of tactical RPGs has an interesting mechanic that is technically death-related. While this mechanic has different names between games, there’s a court system that players can use to pass laws, including ones to reincarnate a character. For example, if a character is at level twenty in the first game, Disgaea: Hour of Darkness , and players decide to reincarnate them, they will technically die, be resurrected at level one, but have higher stats based on what level they died at.

Valkyrie Profile: Covenant Of The Plume

Power Up Before You Die

Valkyrie Profile: Covenant of the Plume
RPG
Systems
Released
March 17, 2009
ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Tri-Ace

Powered by

Valkyrie Profile: Covenant of the Plume is a tactical RPG and one of the hardest around. However, it can be made easier if players lean into a core mechanic. The main character, Wylfred, can use the Destiny Plume item to power up an ally. This will make them stronger in battle, but it will kill them afterward, so players have to decide if they want a harder challenge or an easier time through sacrificial characters who cannot be revived.

item.title: Best Video Games From The 2010s
item.description:
The 2010s were a smashing decade for video games, letting players enjoy some quality experiences that have aged gracefully. This was the golden period when state-of-the-art graphics hadn't taken over the gaming scene yet, giving developers more time to craft stellar experiences that players would have a great time with.

The best video games of this time are ones that players can't put down, and players are missing out on something special if they haven't graced themselves with the gaming brilliance of these legendary titles.

Portal 2

One Of The Greatest Puzzle Games Ever Made

Portal 2
10 /10
11
9.3 /10
Released
April 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Portal 2 is one of the best sequels ever made, expanding on the concepts of the first game and elaborating on the game's lore. A series that already had one of the greatest antagonists of all time was graced with another brilliant villain in the form of Wheatley.

The puzzles were back and better than ever. The cherry on top of this game was a surprisingly engaging co-op game that made Portal 2 even more engaging for the masses.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Legacy Of This Title Speaks For Itself

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
82
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Skyrim is hailed by many as the greatest open-world RPG of all time, and understandably so. The game was in a class of its own back when it came out, with the sense of freedom and exploration being absolutely breathtaking.

The fact that Skyrim is still relevant to this day speaks volumes about the game's longevity, which is definitely helped by Bethesda's numerous re-releases, coupled with the dedication of the modding community. Even now, a few mods are all it takes to make Skyrim one of the most engaging video games ever made, and players will have a great time with it.

The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Nintendo Wowed Everyone With Their Innovative Yet Familiar Take On The Open-World Genre

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
48
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Breath of the Wild blew everyone's minds when it released. Despite not having a major track record in the open-world genre, Breath of the Wild managed to be an evolution for this genre and prove why Nintendo is at the very top of its game when it comes to video game development.

Link's adventures in a ruined Hyrule were meditative and hectic at the same time, with the game doing a great job of walking the line here. The moments of empty exploration feel relaxing... that is, until a particularly powerful enemy takes notice of Link and brings the hurt to them.

Bloodborne

This Gothic FromSoftware Action RPG Wraps Players Around Its Lovecraftian Tendrils In No Time

Bloodborne
23
8.9 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Powered by

It speaks volumes that people consider Bloodborne to be Miyazaki and FromSoftware's magnum opus, given that other games like Dark Souls , Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice , and Elden Ring exist. This gothic adventure hides its Lovecraftian tendrils until players are already absorbed in this experience, following which the experience becomes too compelling to put down.

The Hunter's adventures in the dream are as harrowing and scary as one would expect, which is why every victory against a tough foe leaves players feeling very satisfied. The game is easily FromSoftware's hardest title without being too unfair, ensuring that players will love the sense of progression as their Hunter becomes strong enough to take down the game's toughest foes.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

CD Projekt Red Became A Major Phenomenon With This Title's Release

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the greatest RPGs of all time, letting players enjoy Geralt's video game adventures at their peak as they embark on a hunt across the Continent for Ciri. With Yennefer finally appearing in this blockbuster role-playing game, fans fell in love with this epic adventure from the very moment they got their hands on it.

Both the main and side content were so compelling that players couldn't skip out on anything in the game. To make things even better, this game was graced with two of the greatest video game expansion packs of all time, with Blood & Wine being so brilliant that it earned a Best RPG of the Year all by its lonesome.

Persona 5

Arguably Kickstarted The Modern JRPG Renaissance

Persona 5
11
8.1 /10
Released
September 15, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Persona 5 marked a bold new step for the series, with all its delays being justified when fans finally got their hands on this experience. The release of this stylish JRPG arguably marked the turning point for a genre that was struggling to flourish after it experienced its golden years on the PS1.

Joker and the Phantom Thieves embark on the adventure of a lifetime as they change the hearts of corrupt adults and uncover a massive conspiracy in the process. The fact that Persona 5 makes the simulation of a regular high school student's life engaging is proof enough of how riveting this game is when it's firing on all cylinders.

Super Mario Odyssey

Reminded Everyone Why Mario Is The GOAT Of 3D Platformers

Super Mario Odyssey
10 /10
13
9.6 /10
Released
October 27, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Cartoon Violence, Comic Mischief
Powered by

Super Mario Odyssey showed that Nintendo was putting all its eggs in one basket with the Switch. After the horrible failure of the Wii U, good games were required to make their latest console a raving success, and Super Mario Odyssey accomplished this in spades.

Mario's 3D adventure was seamless, with players entering a flow state as they explored massive environments and found a Moon in every corner of the open zones they explored. The game was overflowing with charm and let players enjoy a smooth, satisfying movement system that very few 3D platformers have nailed.

Fallout: New Vegas

Hailed By Many As One Of The Greatest RPGs Of All Time

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas took a while to win over fans, especially since the game launched in a very buggy state. Thankfully, mods and patches ensure that this game's brilliance wouldn't be buried for too long.

As things stand, New Vegas is hailed as a must-play open-world RPG with some great expansions that fans can enjoy. It combines the best of both old and new Fallout , letting fans enjoy something truly special.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: Wishblossom Ranch - Showcase Trailer
item.description: Disney Dreamlight Valley shares more on its upcoming premium Wishblossom Ranch expansion, with Snow White, Tinkerbell, and Tigger joining the party. Wishblossom Ranch launches in Disney Dreamlight Valley on November 19, 2025.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Shares Plans Through Summer 2026
item.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley has just revealed more than half a year's worth of content planned for the game, laying out its plans through summer 2026 in a streaming showcase. Disney Dreamlight Valley fans are already looking forward to the Wishblossom Ranch expansion in November, but now they've also got plenty more to be excited about, including the debut of a highly requested character in the spring.

The development team at Gameloft revealed Disney Dreamlight Valley 's Wishblossom Ranch DLC in early September. Following the conclusion of the Storybook Vale arc that wrapped up in July, the game's third paid expansion is set to launch on November 19, and it will task players with restoring a dilapidated ranch with the aid of several new mechanics given to rideable horses.

Disney Dreamlight Valley Content Through Summer 2025

  • Wishblossom Ranch Premium Expansion - November 19, 2025
  • The Winter Ball (Cinderella Free Update) - December 10, 2025
  • Lady and the Tramp Free Update - Early 2026
  • Pocahontas Free Update - Spring 2026
  • Hercules Free Update - Summer 2026

While the initial reveal shared the basic story and mechanics behind the Wishblossom Ranch DLC, it lacked that certain Disney vibe, not mentioning any Disney Dreamlight Valley characters associated with the new region. The new showcase fixes that, revealing that its old caretaker, Cruella de Vil, is responsible for its downfall, and showing that Snow White, Tinkerbell, and Tigger will all be helping out. So will special equine characters Maximus from Tangled , Khan from Mulan , and Pegasus from Hercules , each of whom has unique abilities, accompanied by a full herd of customizable horses. Unlike the previous premium expansions, this one will not be split up into two parts, so all characters and quests will be available to unlock at launch.

In addition to a flurry of new Wishblossom Ranch information, the stream also revealed the game's free content roadmap through summer 2026, showing that there will be three free expansions released through the first part of the year. In the creative team's typical style, the names of the characters these expansions are built around are left out, though the images displayed with them show settings from Disney films that make it pretty obvious. As one of the most requested characters from the fan base, Pocahontas will likely be joining Disney Dreamlight Valley in spring 2026, with her Disney Renaissance cohort Hercules following her in the summer. While seemingly not quite as popular among the game's fans, the first update of 2026 will likely bring the canine duo of Lady and the Tramp to the game.

But before 2025's end, Gameloft still has one free update left up its sleeve, coming on December 10. The Cinderella update has been teased since the beginning of June, when the second half of Disney Dreamlight Valley 's 2025 roadmap was revealed. Now, developers have revealed its official name, The Winter Ball. While the Fairy Godmother has been around since the game's launch, the story states that Cinderella vanished at the beginning of The Forgetting, and players must break a protective enchantment placed by the Fairy Godmother to bring the princess back to the valley. Additionally, the December update will introduce Dream Teams, a new feature allowing players to work cooperatively to share resources and complete crafting tasks together.

50
9.3 /10

Disney Dreamlight Valley

Follow
Followed
Life Simulation
Casual
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 75 /100 Critics Rec: 77%
Released
December 5, 2023
ESRB
Everyone / In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Developer(s)
Gameloft
Publisher(s)
Gameloft
10 Images

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Disney Dreamlight Valley is a hybrid between a life-sim and an adventure game rich with quests, exploration, and engaging activities featuring Disney and Pixar friends, both old and new.

Once an idyllic land, Dreamlight Valley was a place where Disney and Pixar characters lived in harmony—until the Forgetting. Night Thorns grew across the land and severed the wonderful memories tied to this magical place. With nowhere else to go, the hopeless inhabitants of Dreamlight Valley retreated behind locked doors in the Dream Castle.Now it’s up to you to discover the stories of this world and bring the magic back to Dreamlight Valley.

Free the Dream Castle from the insidious grip of the Forgetting, and unlock the unique Realms of well-loved Disney and Pixar characters, including great queens and kings such as Anna and Simba. Each Realm contains unique challenges with puzzles to solve in the quest to bring friendship back to the Valley.

You’ll start your adventure in the Valley, but your journey will take you to infinity… and beyond! Explore what lurks in the Forest of Valor and brave the deepest caverns as you take on challenges from iconic Disney and Pixar heroes and villains. Who knows who—or what—you might discover.

item.title: Exclusive First Looks at My Hero Academia: All's Justice and Once Upon a Katamari & More
item.description: Bandai Namco brought out the big guns this week at New York Comic Con, including a demo of the upcoming 3v3 fighter My Hero Academia: All's Justice and a North American first look at Once Upon a Katamari. Combine this with special demos of Little Nightmares 3 and Digimon Story: Time Stranger and you had one of the more impressive booths at the con...plus did we mention CAKE?! Join contributing producer Noah Waterman as he gives his initial impressions to Bandai Namco's latest suite of releases.
